references.paper_title: Multidiffusion: Fusing diffusion paths for controlled image generation
references.reason: This paper proposes a training-free method for multi-instance generation, which is a key concept for the current paper's approach.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces CLIP, a model that is used by many of the base models referenced in this paper, and is important to understanding the capabilities of these base models.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces Stable Diffusion, a foundational model used in several comparative methods in the current paper.

references.paper_title: SDXL: Improving latent diffusion models for high-resolution image synthesis
references.reason: This paper introduces SDXL, a high-resolution image generation model used as a baseline in the current paper.
This paper introduces denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), the foundation of many of the diffusion models used in this paper and its comparative methods.
